review.reviewText: Mold poor ventilation in bathroom   It was very noisy from the road traffic. The location was convenient but not easy to access other services.

review.title: a place to sleep
review.reviewText: It was alright,  the bed was comfortable. Just wish that they had a coffee pot in the rooms. No wifi and if they do have it we weren't told about it.
review.negativeRemarks: coffee pot in  room and the staff needs improvement
review.locationRemarks: Malls and San Francisco is close by.

review.title: This place is a dump I rather stay at Motel 6
review.reviewText: The desk clerk didn't speak much English, no screens in the bathroom window nets and Mosquitos flying in the room was not that clean.

review.title: By the freeway.
review.reviewText: Needed a cheap room quickly. I was able to book this quickly. Bed was okay, heater was good. Channels on tv were terrible. I just needed a room for the night while traveling.

review.title: Good Marin location
review.reviewText: Clean hotel and good location in Corte Madera.  Room a bit small and outside a little dirty but overall good balue
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and covenient location and good value

review.title: A Nice Place
review.reviewText: This is a good location for us when we visit the Mill Valley area
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, good price, parking on site, nice staff & a restaurant next door
review.locationRemarks: Shopping across the street...although the freeway is adjacent, it's quiet...a short cab ride into Mill Valley where we like to go

review.title: Skip this place
review.reviewText: The key to the room assigned to me did not work, but I had to complain to the woman in the office several times before she believed me and checked it out for herself. She lacked all people skills and certainly should not be working with the public. ~ The wi-fi connection did not work, and, once again, the woman argued with me about that. She said she would show me how to access it with my laptop, which I thought was condescending; I told her I knew how to access it: the problem was that the password was wrong. Again, she argued with me, so I just gave up. ~ The toilet was broken, and I could barely get it to work.
review.negativeRemarks: It needs a thorough overhaul. And the woman in the office needs to be fired.

review.title: Location was perfect for my business purpose.
review.reviewText: I had to be in San Francisco all week and I used this hotel because of its location and price.  The structure was very old and had upgrades over the years.  Still, I would call the room only adequate because of size and amenities.  Just reminded me of "old."  The wifi was cumbersome but worked.  For the price and purpose, it fit my business needs, but I would never use it for a family visit.
review.locationRemarks: Good shopping center nearby and many interesting places to visit for business or entertainment within a short drive.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Front door was loosely constructed. Water contol in shower was set backwards- hot was cold and cold was hot - so I almost scalded myself. Freeway noise was horrible. Bed and cleanliness were fine. Location was good.

review.title: DUMP!
review.reviewText: Place was a dump in poor condition. Paint was chipping, grout was falling out, no coffee maker, no tissue, a lot of traffic noise, and the smoke detector was missing! Never again.

review.title: Nice clean hotel.
review.reviewText: The room was small but very nice clean. For me the most valuable was the cleanliness. The only thing bothered me the noise from the freeway.
review.positiveRemarks: The low price and so close to San Francisco.

review.title: ok for a cheap hotel if only it were cheap
review.reviewText:
All rooms face the freeway which is close and loud if you open the window. Bed is crammed against the air conditioner causing it to cycle on and off frequently and fairly noisily  Room is stuffy without open window or air on. 
Very forceful shower not suitable for kids.  Beds were two doubles, not queens as advertised but reasonably firm and plenty of pillows. Room was clean and TV good. Being in Marin apparently justifies the exorbitant price for what is a bare bones hotel.

review.title: Older hotel
review.reviewText: This is an older hotel but the rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable.  We wanted a hotel close to the Larkspur ferry and this was fine for the one night we stayed.

review.title: Staying here makes you feel like a loser
review.reviewText: One of the two bedside lamps has the smallest, dimmest light bulb (twisty) that you can find.  The other beside lamp didn't have a bulb in it at all.  I discovered that while putting my hand upside to see if the bulb was loose.  Thank God the lamp  happened to be in the "off" position, because one of my fingers went inside the socket!  The overhead light had two sockets, but only one bulb inside.  Again, very small and dim.  There was one other lamp on a very tiny table pushed into the corner of the tiny room.  The lamp did not have a bulb inside.  The bathroom sink has it's hot water is turned off somewhere upstream of the fixture.  When I turned on the hot water facet, absolutely no water of ANY temperature came out.  I checked the valve under the sink and it was open.  So it's off somewhere else upstream.  The top of the pop-up drain plug was broken off/missing.  So it was impossible to fill up the sink.  I guess even if it wasn't broken, it would have been difficult to fill up the sink, anyway, because the attachment point for the pop-up was missing.  The sink is a pedestal sink, so there is no counter.  There is no toilet paper holder.  The toilet paper sits in a basket on top of the toilet.  No biggie, except that I had to keep removing the top of the toilet to figure out why it wouldn't flush.  The shower is 28" x 30".  Compare that to an old fashioned shower that is 36" x 36". I couldn't direct the shower water to flow directly on body below the waist.
review.positiveRemarks: Close proximity to the restaurant next door. "Marin Joes" (A  knock-off or break-off of "Original Joes.")
review.negativeRemarks: Put bulbs in the sockets. One should be bright enough for reading.  Make the toilet flush.  Have hot water in the sink.  A stopper, too.

review.title: 1 night
review.reviewText: We just night, the bed was comfortable and the room was clean. It was fine for what we needed .
review.positiveRemarks: clean room and comfortable bed, close to the places that we wanted to go.
review.negativeRemarks: well it would be a great improvement if they had a spa or something.
review.locationRemarks: We stayed at this hotel because it was close to Muir Woods and Stinson Beach, they also have a shopping mall near by and a grocery store.

review.title: Low price tells the story
review.reviewText: Although the room was clean, my overall experiance was a little shaky.  The chair in the room was falling apart, the toilet seat was so loose I cringed when I used it and the shower was down right scary.  I won't be back.  I'm sorry to report there was no coffee maker in the room and I couldn't find any place near by to buy any
review.positiveRemarks: The motel is close to SF and has easy off and on to US101.

review.title: Right next to loud freeway.
review.reviewText: Depressing, unwelcoming desk service (very unhappy desk clerk). Cramped run-down rooms (bed up against window). One room had leaking faucet that could not be turned off (clerk was not surprised or concerned). After complaining and switching rooms twice, we were upgraded to a nicer larger unit which was more comfortable, but the heater was noisy and ineffective, no closet or pegs to hang clothes, a back window on the alley that could not be locked, and still loud freeway noise. The woman who did housekeeping (limited English) was warm, friendly and helpful, and I liked and trusted her. Overall, we saved some money, but it still wasn't cheap; I expected better. Will not return or recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Housekeeping services (we requested fresh towels daily and nothing else.) Upgraded to a larger room that made our stay bearable. Convenient location.
review.negativeRemarks: Fix plumbing, heating, electrical wiring (lamp outlet in same plate as wall switch), closets, security, sound insulation, more welcoming reception.
review.locationRemarks: Easy freeway access. Near Corte Madera Town Center, many shops and cafes.

review.reviewText: Clean and relatively quiet. Some upgrades but nothing fancy. Reasonable value for that area. Very nice front desk person. It fit the bill for what we needed.

So so you got what you pay for
staff was OK
Lacatiin not perfect but not so nesty

review.title: Hotel within 15 min of El Cerrito
review.reviewText: The Drive from hotel into Oakland across the John F. McCarthy Memorial Bridge was very scenic.
review.positiveRemarks: Firm beds and amply hot water
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is limited.  Hotel is right next to highway 101 constant traffic noise. Towels are thin and small.
review.locationRemarks: Marine Joes is right next door and is an excellent restaurant, with a large menu to choose from, superbly prepared food and friendly staff
